page.title: 08MYLOR CHURCH
page.content: It was founded over 1500 years ago in 411 A.D. by St.Mylor, who like other cornish saints of the Celtic church, is linked with Brittany. Services are held on Wednesdays, and twice on Sundays at 8.00 and 10.30 am. St.Peters Church (Flushing)and All Saints (Mylor)also belong to the parish. Mylor still worships traditional events eg.candlemass, whilst most other churches do not.Marriges and Christenings also take place there. The churchyard cross is the tallest old granite cross in Cornwall.It is 17 ft. 6 inches tall, and stood in prehistoric times for pagan worship and was later christianised.St.Mylor is supposedly buried beneath it.
